title: Darwin's Voyage on the Beagle
description: A 60-second lesson on Darwin's Voyage on the Beagle.

hook.text: In 1831, a 22-year-old sailed around the world and changed biology forever.

buildup.text: Charles Darwin joined HMS Beagle as an unpaid naturalist. The voyage lasted five years.

discovery.text: On the GalÃ¡pagos Islands, he noticed each island had slightly different finches.

twist.text: It took him 20 more years to publish his theory. He feared the backlash.

climax.text: On the Origin of Species, published in 1859, became one of the most influential books ever written.

punchline.text: Darwin hesitated for 20 years. Then his book rewrote our understanding of life.
